programme.title: Swing Expedition With Chris Como
programme.desc: Legendary instructor Bill Harmon discusses the fundamentals his father Claude, 1948 Masters Champion, engrained into the Harmon family.

programme.title: Swing Expedition With Chris Como
programme.desc: How Grant Waite became one of the most respected coaches in golf and a deep dive into his swing and his philosophy.

programme.title: Swing Expedition With Chris Como
programme.desc: Jamie Mulligan reveals how he's mentored generations of PGA Tour players and shows the way he watches his students swing the club. Mulligan shares the drills he relies on for tempo and rhythm, and a method to get students to dial in their wedges.

programme.title: Swing Expedition With Chris Como
programme.desc: Chris Como visits with Mike Adams and reveals how to teach the golf swing based on specific body types. Mike demonstrates how the proper grip, backswing, and footwork are decided by your body's measurements.

programme.title: Swing Expedition With Chris Como
programme.desc: Chris Como works out with Joey D, the fitness trainer to golf's longest hitters Dustin Johnson and Brooks Koepka. Learn what band exercises create better body rotation and which medicine ball sequences help increase power.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn creative drills to train a better downswing and find out how Michael Jackson's moonwalk will improve your impact; Devan will also reveal a tip for the transition used by Viktor Hovland.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake will reveal the most important swing angles and teach you how to achieve those positions; learn Devan's favorite drills for ideal angles in the backswing, downswing, at impact and in the finish.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is teaching how to use ground forces to maximize your power; learn how a tennis ball, yoga block, kettlebell and exercise band can be used to train for more distance.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake teaches how to coordinate the lead and trail side body parts to become a better ball striker.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn vital correct information and creative drills to improve grip pressure, footwork, trail arm in the takeaway and head movement throughout the swing.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn how to build a practice station for improving start line, an easy guide to green reading and tips for better speed control used by 2023 Masters Champion Jon Rahm.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn a Ben Hogan tip for improving a backswing, how an alignment stick can cure a transition faults and a creative drill using maracas to shake up a downswing sequence.

programme.title: 5 Clubs with Gary Williams
programme.desc: Viewpoints of people in the game with people who love the game; we discuss what is of interest to them in the vast and deep reservoir of stories within the game of golf.

programme.title: Fairways of Life
programme.desc: New York Times's Best Seller and Golf Channel Host Matt Adams provides unforgettable interviews with golf's legends and stars, as well as lively interactive discussions about the game, travel and the latest in golf equipment.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal are giving a guide that will make 2024 your best year ever on the course; learn how to put your hands on the club like Tiger Woods, improve your accuracy like Ben Hogan and use baseball to hit your golf ball farther.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to drive it longer like a Major Champion; learn a backswing move used by Scottie Scheffler, downswing stretch taught by Jack Nicklaus and solid contact drill straight from Padraig Harrington.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach setup keys, swing changes and creative drills to find more fairways; Martin will also reveal a swing thought that's helped Rory McIlroy become one of the world's best drivers.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to lower your scores by hitting more greens; find out how to setup for success like Xander Schauffele, improve your pivot like Tom Watson and learn a drill used by Tiger Woods to hit laser-like iron.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to control your ball flight like the best players; learn how to draw the ball on command like Rory McIlroy, hit powerful fades like Scottie Scheffler and rip low stingers down the fairway like Tiger Woods.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to improve your accuracy and distance; setup for success like Tommy Fleetwood, improve your swing path like Nelly Korda and learn a drill that helped Morgan Pressel win a Major Championship.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach the most important keys to getting up and down around the green; learn how to setup for success like Phil Mickelson, make solid wedge contact like Luke Donald and control trajectory like Tiger Woods.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach putting grips, styles and drills used by the world's best players; learn how to stop pushing putts like Tiger Woods, eliminate the pull like Scottie Scheffler and put better roll on the ball like Dave Stockton.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach how to stick your mid range to full swing wedge shots; learn how to make solid contact like Collin Morikawa, hit it straight down your target line like Steve Stricker and control distance like Rory McIlroy.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach drills to cure the worst swing faults; learn how to improve your swing plane like Tiger Woods, use a pool noodle to eliminate the chicken wing and fix numerous faults that cause a slice.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal teach the best drills from the best guests in School of Golf history; Martin will also reveal the most special guest in the show's 15 year history and teach a tip that helped them become a champion.
